conclusion: I'll solve this step-by-step by analyzing the power source characteristics and finding the operating point when connected to the resistor.
Line I represents the terminal voltage vs. current relationship for the power source.
Line I intersects the U/V axis at 3V when I = 0A (open circuit voltage).
Line I intersects the I/A axis at 6A when U = 0V (short circuit current).
Line II represents the volt-ampere characteristic of resistor R.
Line II passes through the origin (0,0).

premise: Line I is a straight line with negative slope, intersects U/V axis at 3V, and I/A axis at 6A.
Line II is a straight line passing through the origin and point (2,2).
conclusion: Equation for Line II: U = I

premise: Equations for Line I: U = 3 - 0.5I and Line II: U = I
conclusion: Operating point is where 3 - 0.5I = I, solving gives I = 2A.

premise: Substitute I = 2A into Line I equation: U = 3 - 0.5(2)
conclusion: Voltage at operating point is U = 2V.
